record.title: MORNING BUSINESS

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent the Senate proceed to a period of morning business with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I thank the Chair and suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent to address the Senate as in morning business.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
record.narrative: (The remarks of Mr. Isakson pertaining to the introduction of S. 747 are located in today's Record under "Statements on Introduced Bills and Joint Resolutions.")

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
